#Text=Wikinews Shorts : January 20 , 2008
#Text=A compilation of brief news reports for Sunday , January 20 , 2008 .
#Text=Suharto shows ' amazing signs of recovery '
#Text=Former Indonesian president Suharto , 86 , is now moving and speaking softly , doctors say .
#Text=He was admitted to Pertamina Hospital in Jakarta on January 4 after suffering multiple organ failure .
#Text=" He is fully conscious , he can follow instructions and answer our questions in a weak voice , " Dr. Jusuf Misbach said .
#Text=" He scratched himself and raised his hands .

#Text=Zimbabwe , Zambia suffer widespread power outages
#Text=Major power outages in Zimbabwe and Zambia left many without services such as electricity , water , and mobile phone connections for much of Saturday and Sunday .
#Text=The blackout reportedly hit the two nations almost simultaneously on Saturday evening .
#Text=In Zambia , the power was restored eight hours later , but residents of Zimbabwe had to wait until Sunday afternoon for power .
#Text=Officials in Harare said the cause of the blackout was a fault that " tripped " the power grid , while some in Zambia blamed " turbine problems " at one of the country 's hydroelectric dams .

column1: #Text=40 % of Zimbabwe 's power is imported from neighboring countries like South Africa .

#Text=As the power situation in South Africa has also been worsening , state utility company Eskom announced it will stop supplying power to Zimbabwe and other countries in order to meet domestic needs .
#Text=Sources
#Text=Angus Shaw .
#Text=" Power Outages in Zambia , Zimbabwe " — Associated Press , January 20 , 2008

column1: #Text=South African Press Association .
#Text=" Mbeki demands answers from Eskom chiefs " — Independent Online , January 20 , 2008
#Text=Francis Joyon sails world in 57 days , breaks record
#Text=Francis Joyon of France completed his maritime journey around the globe in a 57 days , 13 hours , 34 minutes , and 6 seconds , breaking Ellen MacArthur 's record by 2 weeks .
#Text=He sailed the world 's oceans in a trimaran of his own making .
#Text=The journey began November 23 in the port of Brest .
#Text=Joyon then sailed under the tip of Africa and across the Southern Hemisphere before making his way back to France .
#Text=MacArthur was there to greet him when he landed on shore .
#Text=" I 'm really happy for him , proud of him , " she said .
#Text=" He was very fast , he played really well , and he really deserves this record . "
#Text=MacArthur had previously beaten Joyon 's record in 2005 .
#Text=" The speed part , the sailing passion part , that 's extraordinary .
